sentences.english: The semantic representation of topic structure is mapped onto syntax by GFT interface.
sentences.chinese: 主題結構的語義通過語法功能層界面影射到句法。

sentences.english: I didn't allude to  anybody or anything.
sentences.chinese: 我並未影射任何人或任何事。

sentences.english: Or positively-- but not enough from positively.
sentences.chinese: 或者積極的，但對積極影射的研究不夠。

sentences.english: Authoring templates are mapped to presentation templates.
sentences.chinese: 編寫模板被影射到演示模板。

sentences.english: This thesis studies innuendo speech act from the angle of pragmatics.
sentences.chinese: 本文從語用學的角度研究了影射言語行爲。

sentences.english: He had been subject to a campaign of innuendo in the press.
sentences.chinese: 他一直受到新聞界指桑罵槐的影射。

sentences.english: The memory of the people who were primed with "old" words.
sentences.chinese: 用與“老“相關的詞影射過的人的記憶力。

sentences.english: The familial allusion was left off the album.
sentences.chinese: 這張專輯上對家庭的影射就此止步。

sentences.english: I didn't allude to anybody or anything.
sentences.chinese: 我並未影射如何人或任何事。

sentences.english: I didn't insinuate anybody or anything.
sentences.chinese: 我並未影射如何人或任何事。

sentences.english: The chairman talked at Henderson at the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 主席在會議上影射亨德森。

sentences.english: The story alluded to a mystery in her past.
sentences.chinese: 故事影射她過去生活中的一個祕密。

sentences.english: How can the framework of the legal definition of insinuate and imply?
sentences.chinese: 又如何在法律的框架下定義影射與暗示？

sentences.english: So he primed people with "old" words.
sentences.chinese: 他用與老有關的詞影射人們。

sentences.english: So they insinuated that using antibacterial soap will prevent people from getting these specific illnesses.
sentences.chinese: 因此他們影射了那使用抗菌肥皂將防止人得此病症。

sentences.english: The facts did not support the accusations and innuendos.
sentences.chinese: 這些指控和影射與事實不符。

definition: to defame/to libel/to defile/to smear/to vilify
to attack someone by innuendo (idiom)/to make oblique charges/to make insinuations/to insinuate

dramatic form consisting of historical narration/history as jocular narrative/to stretch history for a joking story/amusing story with strained interpretations of history/to make an unreasonable comparison in jest
to use the past to disparage the present (idiom)
